articles.headline: Banks Study Bailing Out Struggling Bond Insurer
articles.snippet: Officials from Merrill Lynch, Bear Stearns and other major banks are in talks to bail out ACA Capital Holdings, according to two people briefed on the situation.
articles.abstract: Officials from Merrill Lynch, Bear Stearns and other major banks are in talks to bail out ACA Capital Holdings, according to two people briefed on the situation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Officials from Merrill Lynch, Bear Stearns and other major banks are in talks to bail out a struggling bond insurance company that has guaranteed $26 billion in mortgage securities, according to two people briefed on the situation, because the insurer’s woes could force the banks to take on billions in losses they had insured against.
articles.byline: By Vikas Bajaj and Gretchen Morgenson

articles.headline: Pension Fund Shortages Create Hard Choices
articles.snippet: Almost half of the states may have to choose in the years ahead between their pension obligations and other public programs.
articles.abstract: Almost half of the states may have to choose in the years ahead between their pension obligations and other public programs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Almost half of the states have been underfunding their retirement plans for public workers and may have to choose in the years ahead between their pension obligations and other public programs, according to a comprehensive study to be released to the public on Wednesday.

articles.headline: Picture of Secret Detentions Emerges in Pakistan
articles.snippet: Nearly 100 suspected terrorists have been released in an apparent effort to avoid acknowledging secret detentions.
articles.abstract: Nearly 100 suspected terrorists have been released in an apparent effort to avoid acknowledging secret detentions.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistan’s military and intelligence agencies, apparently trying to avoid acknowledging an elaborate secret detention system, have quietly set free nearly 100 men suspected of links to terrorism, few of whom were charged, human rights groups and lawyers here say.

articles.headline: Insurers Seek Bigger Reach in Coverage
articles.snippet: The insurance industry planned to propose a series of steps the companies say would let more individuals obtain coverage.
articles.abstract: The insurance industry planned to propose a series of steps the companies say would let more individuals obtain coverage.
articles.lead_paragraph: Acknowledging that too many people simply cannot obtain health insurance on their own, the insurance industry plans on Wednesday to propose a series of steps the companies say would let more individuals, even those who have health problems, obtain coverage.

articles.headline: No. 1 Book, and It Offers Solutions
articles.snippet: “Overtreated,” by Shannon Brownlee, is the best description I have yet read of a huge economic problem that we know how to solve — but is so often misunderstood.
articles.abstract: “Overtreated,” by Shannon Brownlee, is the best description I have yet read of a huge economic problem that we know how to solve — but is so often misunderstood.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 1967, Jack Wennberg, a young medical researcher at Johns Hopkins, moved his family to a farmhouse in northern Vermont.

articles.headline: F.C.C. Reshapes Rules Limiting Media Industry
articles.snippet: The Federal Communications Commission set new rules regulating the size and scope of the news and cable firms.
articles.abstract: The Federal Communications Commission set new rules regulating the size and scope of the news and cable firms.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Federal Communications Commission approved two new rules on Tuesday that are likely to reshape the nation’s media landscape by setting new parameters for the size and scope of the largest news and cable companies.

articles.headline: In Reversal, Fed Approves Plan to Curb Risky Lending
articles.snippet: The new rules would force companies to show that customers can realistically afford their mortgages.
articles.abstract: The new rules would force companies to show that customers can realistically afford their mortgages.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve, acknowledging that home mortgage lenders aggressively sold deceptive loans to borrowers who had little chance of repaying them, proposed a broad set of restrictions Tuesday on exotic mortgages and high-cost loans for people with weak credit.

articles.headline: Detroit Revival Vies With Industry’s Decline
articles.snippet: Even as Detroit shows encouraging signs of life, the automobile industry, the city’s life force, faces further declines in the coming year.
articles.abstract: Even as Detroit shows encouraging signs of life, the automobile industry, the city’s life force, faces further declines in the coming year.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  For decades, city leaders and local business executives here have been predicting an imminent revival of their desolate downtown. For all their cheerleading, though, nothing much changed.
articles.byline: By Micheline Maynard and Nick Bunkley
